head.supplied: Memorandum for His Excellency Sir George F. Bowen Governor of Victoria &c. ¶ ¶ The Chief Secretary has the honor to return to His Excellency the Secretary of State's Despatch of the 16th of December ...

div.p: No. 777, unit 42, pp. 375-6, VPRS 1187/P outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
Memorandum for His Excellency Sir George F. Bowen Governor of Victoria &c.

The Chief Secretary has the honor to return to His Excellency the Secretary of State's Despatch of the 16th of December 1875 (No 76) on the subject of procuring a supply of seed of Eucalyptus Ficifolia for the Préfet of Algiers.

The Government Botanist report that this plant is as yet only known as growing at Brooke's Inlet about 70 miles from King George's Sound
WA. in an unsettled country of a wild and impervious character. The seed is valued at thirty shillings an ounce. None of it is to be had in Melbourne at present; but the Government Botanist expects to receive a new supply shortly. When it arrives half a pound will be forwarded to His Excellency together with a statement of the cost.
